titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Francis B. Stryker and John Delaplaine land conveynace 1991.026
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:12:35 +0000.

did.unittitle: Francis B. Stryker and John Delaplaine land conveynace
did.abstract: A conveyance between Francis B. Stryker, Mayor of the City of Brooklyn, to John Delaplaine for property located in Brooklyn. The property sold was located on Navy Stret in the Seventh Ward of Brooklyn. The conveyance is dated 1846.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Francis B. Stryker and John Delaplaine land conveynace, 1991.026, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
